## Welcome!

Welcome to the R for Novices lesson series using the Gapminder dataset.

This is an adapted version of the [Software Carpentry R-novice-gapminder](https://swcarpentry.github.io/r-novice-gapminder/) course, designed to provide a clearer, more focused learning experience. These lessons can be used by instructors for teaching side-by-side or by students to follow along independently.

## Available Lessons

1. [Exploring Data Frames](lessons/exploring_dataframes.html) - Learn to manipulate and explore data frames in R
2. [Subsetting Data](lessons/data_subsetting.html) - Master techniques for extracting subsets of data
3. [Control Flow](lessons/control_flow.html) - Make decisions with if/else statements and repeat operations with loops
4. [Creating Publication-Quality Graphics with ggplot2](lessons/ggplot2.html) - Build professional visualizations using the grammar of graphics
5. [Functions Explained](lessons/functions.html) - Understand and create your own R functions
6. [Writing Data](lessons/writing_data.html) - Learn to export and save your data
7. [Data Frame Manipulation with dplyr](lessons/dplyr.html) - Master data wrangling with dplyr verbs and pipes

## About

This is a decluttered adaptation of Software Carpentry's R programming course, optimized for teaching and learning. The content has been streamlined to provide clear, focused lessons while maintaining the core learning objectives.

## Getting Started

To follow along with these lessons, you'll need:

- R (version 4.0 or higher)
- RStudio (recommended)
- The gapminder package

Install the gapminder package with:

```r
install.packages("gapminder")
```
